titleStmt.title: Christ, on his throne; not in popish secrets A prophecie of Christ, against his pretended presence in popish secrets; laid open in a sermon preached before his Maiestie at Wansted certaine yeares agoe, and since much inlarged, and (vpon request) preached else where. By Richard Sheldon, Doctor in Diuinitie, his Maiesties chaplaine. In the preface whereof, there is also a briefe inquirie made by him, into a late sermon, stiled, The communion of saints.
titleStmt.author: Sheldon, Richard, d. 1642?

titleStmt.title: Christ, on his throne; not in popish secrets A prophecie of Christ, against his pretended presence in popish secrets; laid open in a sermon preached before his Maiestie at Wansted certaine yeares agoe, and since much inlarged, and (vpon request) preached else where. By Richard Sheldon, Doctor in Diuinitie, his Maiesties chaplaine. In the preface whereof, there is also a briefe inquirie made by him, into a late sermon, stiled, The communion of saints.
titleStmt.author: Sheldon, Richard, d. 1642?

notesStmt.note: "The communion of saints" is by Edward Maie.
The title page is a cancel. Variant: with cancellandum title page, which has "else-where" and "sermon styled The".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
